description: This menu is presented to users to navigate your bot

text: What can I do for you?
Looks like you got distracted. We can continue later.
Yes! Bots will work in VR.
There's more reason than to interact conversationally with software in VR
Have you ever tried TYPING on a virtual keyboard while wearing goggles? It is no fun!
Looks like you got distracted. We can continue later.

With learning mode enabled, you can train me with replies to specific phrases just by talking to me.

To start, send me a message that I should have a good response for. If I don't already have one, we can create one together that you can edit later.
Looks like you got distracted. We can continue later.

description: When enabled in your project and set as fallback, allows you to add scripts by talking to your bot

text: I do not know how to respond to that message. Would you like to create a reply now?
Looks like you got distracted. We can continue later.
What should I say when someone says "{{origin.text}}"
OK. Send me another message to keep training.

I encountered an error with the Botkit Studio API while creating this script. 

The error was: {{vars.error}}

I don't know how to respond to that, and my learning mode is not enabled.

Either enable learning mode, by adding `LEARNING_MODE=true` to my `.env file`, or [change my fallback script setting in Botkit Studio](https://studio.botkit.ai/app/bots/{{vars.bot.botkit_studio_id}}/edit)

description: Built-in content to help you get started

text: I can help with these things:
Looks like you got distracted. We can continue later.

My menu is a special script that uses “quick replies” to suggest useful options to people when they first begin their chat session with me. 

Quick replies can also be used to build menus and connect conversations from messages in other scripts. Just make sure the "payload" of the quick reply matches a trigger.

Use Botkit Studio's dialog editor to customize the message and options presented in my menu.

[Launch Botkit Studio Script Editor](https://studio.botkit.ai/app/bots/{{vars.bot.botkit_studio_id}}/scripts)

The Botkit team loves to hear from other humans who are interested in bots! There are lots of resources available, and a few ways to get in touch.

[Botkit Studio Knowledge Base](https://botkit.groovehq.com/help_center)

[Community Slack](https://community.botkit.ai)

[Github Issues](https://github.com/howdyai/botkit/issues)

The look and feel of this chat window is highly customizable. Using basic HTML and CSS, you can do everything from changing the colors to completely changing the way it looks and acts.

[Here is a guide to customizing and extending the chat window](https://github.com/howdyai/botkit-starter-web/blob/master/docs/botkit_web_client.md)

description: Built-in tutorial to help you get started

text:
Bots can be useful for performing all sorts of tasks, but they do their jobs in 2 basic ways:

They can **communicate information conversationally**, and they can **perform code-driven tasks** on behalf of humans.

In Botkit bots like me, scripted dialog can be managed in [Botkit Studio](https://studio.botkit.ai), while functionality is built with "skill" modules plugged into the framework itself.
Looks like you got distracted. We can continue later.
What do you want to do next?

The responses I send are based on dialog scripts that are triggered when I receive a message that matches a keyword or pattern. These scripts and triggers are managed in Botkit Studio.

[Open my script editor](https://studio.botkit.ai/app/bots/{{vars.bot.botkit_studio_id}}/scripts)

I also come with a built-in **learning mode** that can be used to create scripts by chatting with me here. To use learning mode, just send me messages! I will let you know if I do not have an appropriate response.

New code-driven abilities are added to your bot in the form of skill modules. These can do things like send information to an external API, read information from a database, or send an email to another human.

From inside a module, developers can access all of Botkit's core functionality, as well as any other API or Node library.

[Here is a guide to creating skill modules](https://github.com/howdyai/botkit-starter-web/blob/master/docs/how_to_build_skills.md)

[Here is the Botkit developer guide](https://github.com/howdyai/botkit/blob/master/docs/readme.md#developing-with-botkit)

You can automatically generate skill modules to extend Botkit Studio dialog scripts. Look for the "Code" button in the script editor toolbar.

[Here are some docs about building skill modules for Botkit Studio](https://github.com/howdyai/botkit/blob/master/docs/readme-studio.md#function-index)
